ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Hello everyone
ygData.msgSnippet: Hiya, Judy. =)  Well, it s hard to kick the habit but essentially schoolwork pretty much demanded it.  I took two accelerated courses this summer and that
ygData.messageBody:
Hiya, Judy. =)  Well, it's hard to kick the habit but essentially schoolwork pretty much demanded it.  I took two accelerated courses this summer and that really kicked my butt, which made it aLOT easier to say goodbye.  Also, Verant had upset me personally over my account (which I'd had since March of '99, without EVER missing a payment, thank you very much), and there was the whole fact that Celedhros and I were finding that our battle plans were starting to take on the complexity of a good Othello match. <grin>  Two rangers can be VERY effective, if the rangers in question are very, very careful...  anyway, it was all getting to be a bit much, and school comes first. 
 
Ebony blade... wow... that's the one we collected the fangs for, right?
 
Aelwesara C├╗thalion, formerly of Povar
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Judy Tyrer
To: EQ_women@egroups.com
Sent: Thursday, October 19, 2000 4:06 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_women] Hello everyone

I remember you!  I have played through a bizillion alts in my lifetime (sigh). 
 
Anyway, the good news about rangers is how bad the rep is.  I play a ranger on TP, the new server.  At 12 I got an Ebony Blade because I was the only ranger anyone in the group knew.  Another one went up on the boards because no one in that group knew any rangers ;-) 
 
I play, when possible which it hasn't been in forever, with a now 55 ranger on Brell (sylvanar, I play Iceiallana, a 54 druid).  He has no trouble getting groups anymore.  A lot of the flack is over and it has turned into a huge joke.   I get some grief for being a ranger, but there are only 22 of us on the new server (giggles) and since casters outnumber tanks 3:1 now, anyone who can tank is wanted for groups.
 
As for kicking the habit, congratulatoins.  I've come close twice but never succeeded.  <sigh>
 
Lahstia, the lost ranger on Tholuxe Paells
Dnaice, wizard from Quellious (long long ago)
Dnaisha, Iceiallana, Cerres, Caedusia, from Brell
